content.textual:
*María got her high school diploma.\nShe got her high school diploma in May.\nShe wants to take a break.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Maria got in May her high school diploma and wants a break.
Maria got her high school diploma in May and wants to take a break.
Maria wants to take a break. In May she got her high school diploma.
Maria got her high school diploma in May.
b

*Luisa and Karina are talented.\nThey are my friends.\nThey go to the club.\nLuisa and María play tennis.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Luisa and Karina go to the club and play tennis.
They go to the club Luisa and Karina to play tennis and they are my friends.
 My talented friends Luisa and Karina go to the club to play tennis.
I have talented friends who go to the club to play tennis.
c

*The kids are in the park.\nThe kids are playing soccer.\nThe kids are tired.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
The tired kids are in the park playing soccer.
The kids are playing soccer and tired.
The kids are in the park and tired.
They are playing in the park, and they are tired.
a

*Isaac is a dentist.\nIsaac works from Monday to Friday.\nIsaac loves his job.\nIsaac is tired and wants to retire soon.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Isaac wants to retire from his job, and he works Monday to Friday as a dentist.
Isaac is a dentist who works from Monday to Friday and wants to retire soon.
Isaac, a dentist who loves his job, works from Monday to Friday and wants to retire soon.
Isaac wants to retire soon; he is a dentist and loves his job.
c

*Daria wants to go to the party.\nHer parents didn’t give her permission.\nShe has an important exam tomorrow.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Daria wants to go to the party, but her parents didn’t give her permission because she has an important exam tomorrow. 
Daria doesn’t have permission to go to the party because she has an important exam.
Daria wants to go to the party btu she has an important exam tomorrow.
Daria has an important exam tomorrow because she can’t go to eh party.
a

*My parents heard my speech.\nMy parents are proud.\nThey want to take me out for lunch.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
My parents are proud of me and want to go to have lunch.
My parents heard my speech and are so proud of me that want to take me out for lunch.
My parents want to take me out for lunch because they are proud of me.
 My parents and I are going to have lunch because I gave a nice speech.
b

*Insulin is a hormone.\nThe pancreas makes insulin.\nInsulin helps glucose in your blood enter cells in your muscle. \nInsulin in blood is used for energy.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Insulin is a hormone made by the pancreas that helps glucose in your blood enter muscle, where it’s used for energy.
Insulin is energy that the muscles need to enter the blood hormones.
Insulin is a hormone made by the pancreas; we use it for energy in our muscles.
Muscles are the ones that use insulin as energy because the pancreas helps them enter the cells.
a

content.name: aPrU

content.name: Ewk0

content.text: Los ejercicios 18-25 se basan en la siguiente lectura:
content.name: zjMV

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">1</small>"Stress is bad for you" is something we usually hear regarding health.
content.name: wOBK

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Indeed, there are symptoms of stress we can't ignore, and it is proven
content.name: XKN5

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>chronic stress is a cause of many major health problems, such as heart
content.name: aHAC

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>disease and cancer.
content.name: xjo6

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">5</small>Stress is a natural or automatic response developed in our ancestors to
content.name: sbmV

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>protect us from predators and other threats. Whenever we face danger, our
content.name: 5SD6

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>bodies kick into gear and release stress hormones such as adrenaline and
content.name: fMvF

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>cortisol that elevate our heart rate, increase our blood pressure, and prepare
content.name: uviW

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>us to deal with the problem.
content.name: OD4V

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">10</small>In modern days, we are not in danger of being eaten by a lion, but we
content.name: UaYB

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>must deal with multiple challenges daily. Challenges that go from simple, like
content.name: PsJk

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>driving our car to work, organizing our schedule, cooking a meal, to complex
content.name: qHSR

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>ideas, like setting up a business, being mugged, paying bills and taxes.
content.name: k5IE

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Simple and complex challenges make our bodies react the same
content.name: y7eT

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">15</small>way, known as a "fight or flight" response: our body's natural alarm
content.name: nEGQ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>system. This can have severe consequences for our health.
content.name: w7wv

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>We ignore this, but minor stress can have an impact; for example, giving a
content.name: B8HV

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>presentation can cause a stomachache, and more stress, caused by a
content.name: PuQe

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>hurricane, can have a more significant effect.
content.name: KZ81

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">20</small>Repeated high-stress situations can cause inflammation in the
content.name: 3RWw

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>circulatory system and high cholesterol levels.
content.name: rER5

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>The longer the stress lasts, it becomes a part of your life and harms your
content.name: ZCbU

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>mind and body. You may suffer from chronic fatigue, inability to focus, or
content.name: QCMQ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>being irritable without a reason. We also know that stress can cause wear
content.name: hPQU

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">25</small>and tear on our bodies.
content.name: GPj3

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Living under stress for an extended period of time can cause physical and
content.name: m6r7

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>mental problems, such as anxiety, depression, digestive issues, headaches,
content.name: cy3q

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>stroke, sleep problems, weight gain, and memory issues.
content.name: Zsht

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>It has been proven that stress makes us change our habits, and there are
content.name: axEa

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">30</small>changes we make in our routines to cope with stress, such as smoking,
content.name: CAXY

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>eating ultra-processed food, or drinking alcohol, which harm our bodies even
content.name: JFnO

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>more.
content.name: Zb2f

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>It is hard to talk about stress these days, as we know it has become a part of
content.name: v1KJ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>life, but we should look for things we can do in order to feel better and
content.name: TGEH

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">35</small>protect our health in the long term.
content.name: NyAc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>There are some strategies that require professional help, such as going to
content.name: IQy1

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>therapy or taking medication. Other techniques could help. For example, we
content.name: yCAZ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>monitor our minds throughout the day and write down thoughts and moods
content.name: Vqep

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>to learn about the causes and find a way to cope with them.
content.name: X8Cu

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">40</small>Having good relationships with cheerful, optimistic, and understanding
content.name: veI8

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>people can help reduce our stress levels. We need that emotional support
content.name: vIVg

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>when we are going through tough times.
content.name: L8rV

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Getting enough rest will help us deal with stress, as sleeping between six
content.name: 3tg4

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>and eight hours per night is recommended. In order to rest our minds, we
content.name: i3TN

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">45</small>should cut back on caffeine, remove the use of mobile phones or
content.name: 24Nj

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>electronic devices before going to bed, and, of course, the old time favorite:
content.name: DYZy

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>working out.
content.name: 9DIr

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>There are some other ways to cope with stress, but we can learn about it in
content.name: zfJs

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>our next article. Please message us on social media and tell us how you
content.name: Mw0Q

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">45</small>manage stress.

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">5</small>their children shapes the way they interact with others.
content.name: 286Y

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Family interactions can build up or destroy someone's self-confidence.
content.name: 4AkO

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>When families are united and communicative, they usually help children gain
content.name: iKyE

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>self-confidence and self-esteem. It has been observed that children who are
content.name: baf5

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>encouraged to pursue their choices grow up having a greater sense of
content.name: TgdR

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">10</small>confidence and individuality. Family activities like camping, traveling,
content.name: Plvn

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>taking classes, or retreats can also help children build self-confidence.
content.name: XkuO

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>There is confusion about being an involved parent without smothering, so
content.name: CMuA

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>we will go over helicopter parenting. This term was taken from teens who
content.name: S3Xc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>said their parents would hover over them like a helicopter. There are similar
content.name: lkYG

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">15</small>terms like bulldozing parenting or cosseting parenting.
content.name: tTHo

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>A helicopter parent is a parenting style where mom and dad, or both of
content.name: ddUr

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>them, are highly involved in their kid's life. The focus on their child is so
content.name: ukJ3

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>intense that it can negatively impact a child's mental health. Children of
content.name: deUb

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>helicopter parents constantly shadow the child and don't allow them to have
content.name: VjDW

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">20</small>alone time.
content.name: L27C

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>In elementary school, most helicopter parents will ensure their child gets a
content.name: whMi

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>specific teacher, choose their child's friends and activities, and do their
content.name: WRUl

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>homework.
content.name: nPNk

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Why are there helicopter parents? What causes helicopter parenting? There
content.name: cqS1

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">25</small>can be many causes. However, we will focus on anxiety,
content.name: eSyG

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>overcompensation, and peer pressure from other parents.
content.name: l9TS

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>When parents worry about the economy, their jobs, security, government,
content.name: UkFo

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>and everything in life, they may take control over their children's lives to
content.name: BcCY

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>protect them. They think they are empowered to keep their child from being
content.name: wrOc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">30</small>hurt.
content.name: o91g

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Now, some adults might have felt neglected or ignored when growing up
content.name: J1mY

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>could overcompensate with their children. This excessive monitoring could
content.name: W9FD

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>be an attempt to remedy their parents' deficiency in their upbringing.
content.name: PQSo

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Sometimes, parents see other parents utterly involved with their children,
content.name: Ju9T

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">35</small>triggering a similar response. They may feel like bad parents if they are
content.name: 8U2n

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>not over-involved in their children's lives.
content.name: XYGa

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Most helicopter parents start with good intentions, but there is a thin line
content.name: Ixre

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>between being engaged with our children and their lives, and we can lose
content.name: 0N0d

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>perspective on their needs.
content.name: nQrl

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">40</small>As previously mentioned, parents who are involved with their children
content.name: xr7v

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>bring many benefits for them, such as opportunities to grow or better
content.name: cPTc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>self-confidence. But if we cross that thin line, children can be governed by
content.name: hQsV

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>fear, and decisions are made based on what might happen. Failure and
content.name: MHWn

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>challenges teach kids new skills and the certainty they can handle loss and
content.name: khgi

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">40</small>challenges.
content.name: KqAw

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Some consequences of having helicopter parents can be decreased
content.name: l9tT

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>confidence and self-esteem, coping skills, anxiety, undeveloped life skills, or
content.name: URCY

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>a sense of entitlement.
content.name: xEf1

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>We want to take care of our children, but we don't want to neglect their
content.name: n2oF

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">50</small>ability to learn essential life skills. It is important to let our children
content.name: IEyH

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>struggle and be disappointed; in the end, we will help them work through
content.name: R1Ol

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>failure.
content.name: ibUC
g97u

content.text: Los ejercicios 34-45 se basan en la siguiente lectura.
content.name: e6sV

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">1</small>Talking about habits becomes a matter of whether to succeed in life or not.
content.name: yaS0

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Habits are why you might be in shape or not, if you are happy or not, and
content.name: UOTd

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>your success in life.
content.name: QFxb

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>What we do daily, what we think daily, and how we proceed to do things
content.name: b4wS

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">5</small>shape our person. It would be best to learn how habits work to improve or
content.name: i1Wn

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>form new habits. This has to do with psychology, so learning about
content.name: RkdT

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>behaviorism and reading about Skinner, Pavlov, and the dog is a good idea.
content.name: E3Fw

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>The science behind forming habits comes from Pavlov, a Nobel prize winner
content.name: D2qJ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>for his medical work. He worked primarily with dogs to research the
content.name: DnWi

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">10</small>digestive system. Pavlov measured the amount of saliva that dogs
content.name: y9xk

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>produce as part of digestion and noticed that dogs would salivate when they
content.name: LLRA

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>saw food, even before they tasted it. Then he noticed that other events that
content.name: vrXQ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>were paired or related to food made the dogs start salivating. This is what
content.name: qwqy

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>we know as Classical conditioning.
content.name: xOXg

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">15</small>When you pair two things together (a stimulus and a response) and add
content.name: 5u3y

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>an additional stimulus, you can, at some point, remove the original stimulus
content.name: 8LRh

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>and then have the additional stimulus elicit the response.
content.name: 0Wnt

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>What does this have to do with habits? We are not dogs, but we certainly
content.name: lED6

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>respond to stimulus, and there is always a "response." For example, people
content.name: o3cJ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">20</small>who drink alcohol as a response are mainly triggered by something in
content.name: V5zy

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>particular. It can be how someone talks to them or a specific flavor they
content.name: HDAF

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>taste. People who overeat may suffer from anxiety and can compulsively eat
content.name: XnSw

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>due to an email they read or something they heard.
content.name: 1pJ9

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>When it comes to creating or changing a habit, we should remember that
content.name: d6uL

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">25</small>small and specific actions are more likely to become habitual. If you
content.name: aWcr

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>want to start working out and say: "I will work every single day of my life" or
content.name: tu3q

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>"From now on, I'm going to work out a lot," it is unlikely to become a habit
content.name: PVlp

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>because it's a too general objective.
content.name: PuY1

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>If you start with small actions like working out three times a week as soon as
content.name: 8fN4

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">30</small>you get up from bed or say: "I will bounce on the trampoline from
content.name: PGCc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Monday to Friday at 7:00 for 20 minutes" it is specific, and it can work.
content.name: sBMe

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>An excellent tip to consider is that making the action attainable increases the
content.name: N0Jn

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>likelihood of becoming a habit. If we talk about exercise, you should make it
content.name: qVOM

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>easy for yourself: have your outfits ready the night before so you don't have
content.name: cCgo

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">35</small>to make any decisions that could get you on a detour from working out.
content.name: 4UBF

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Habits that include visual or auditory cues will be easier to create and
content.name: ZaZe

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>maintain. An easy example of this is using our phones in the morning. As
content.name: u0pm

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>there is a buzz or noise, or the lights are too bright, they become cues that
content.name: QGUR

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>grab our attention and increase the likelihood that we will develop a
content.name: GHV4

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">40</small>conditioned response.
content.name: 0G3P

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>There are habits we would like to change, like smoking, overeating, eating
content.name: 81vT

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>ultra-processed foods, not working out. And, the best way to change a habit
content.name: mSm5

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>we don't like is to create a new one to replace it.
content.name: 1XTX

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>For example, if you have the habit of coming at the end of the day, grabbing
content.name: lho7

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">45</small>a beer and some chips, and turning the TV on to become a coach
content.name: GQma

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>potato for hours, you are most likely to realize you could have spent that
content.name: cjcc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>time working out or doing something else that could help you with health.
content.name: hGnN

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>If you want to change that habit, you must return to the beginning of the
content.name: L0qc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>stimulus/response cycle and replace the current response with a different
content.name: V36N

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">50</small>one.
content.name: eA39

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Within seven days you will have conditioned walking into your house to a
content.name: 7t0n

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>different response, for example, working out.
content.name: 2hQY

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>It would help if you tried this: choosing a new habit you want to create or an
content.name: L8ZJ

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>existing one you want to change, then, think about the stimulus and
content.name: 6Jso

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">55</small>response. Make sure the action is small and attached to something
content.name: icxC

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>physical, and if possible, use visual or auditory cues.
content.name: UA6U

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Habits can be easily confused with routines, so a habit is a response to an
content.name: qBjA

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>ingrained impulse, as opposed to routines, that involve repeated behavior.
content.name: Uk6Q

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>You may have a routine to wash the dishes without feeling an impulse to do
content.name: MAgP

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">60</small>it but because you need to do those things.
content.name: 6fLd

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Breaking a habit can be difficult because that person may not be fully aware
content.name: NkVe

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>of how their habit works. If you are more conscious about habits and how
content.name: BuDP

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>they work, you should learn they don't come naturally. Some authors
content.name: Rdlq

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>mention that you need 21 or 90 days to break or create a new habit.
content.name: EnId

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">65</small>According to James Clear, the author of one of the best sellers on
content.name: 6pKa

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>habits, on average, it takes more than two months before a new behavior
content.name: oKUe

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>becomes automatic: 66 days.
content.name: xFm4

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>We should consider that new habit formation depends widely on the
content.name: wIGc

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>behavior, the person, and the circumstances.
content.name: 2Vma

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">70</small>Something helpful to keep in mind is to find inspiration in the long road,
content.name: qjGg

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>find people who are on the same or a similar path as yours, and follow their
content.name: dz4P

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>updates. You shouldn't judge yourself if you can't "create a habit" in 21 days.
content.name: bXyd

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>Start with Day 1 because that Day 1 can make a massive difference in the
content.name: eBPM

content.text: <small class="opacity-25">-</small>rest of your life.
content.name: hkam

What is the text about?
Behaviorism
The way habits shape our life
How to create or change habits
Science behind habits
C

What is the relationship between habits and psychology?
Forming habits was discovered by Pavlov, who observed that dogs had a response to a certain stimulus
Learning about Skinner and Pavlov would help you understand it.
That Pavlov has a Nobel prize and that makes him trustworthy.
That stimulus and response are related.
A

What did he notice during his research on the digestive system?
That dogs needed their saliva to be measured.
That footsteps would make dogs salivate.
Classical conditioning. 
That dogs would salivate when they saw food, even before eating it.
D

In line 18, what does the author mean when he clarifies “we are not dogs”?
That we shouldn’t be treated like dogs.
That we respond to stimulus.
That even if the experiment was conducted on dogs, we also have this stimulus-response behavior. 
That dogs start salivating when we don’t.
C

According to the text, what may happen to a person that suffer from anxiety and receive an email that causes stress?
They may eat compulsively
They may drink alcohol
They may smoke
They may work out
A

What does the word “attainable” on line 32 could be substituted for?
reachable
impossible
unreachable
unreasonable
A

In line 35, what does the author mean when he uses the word “detour”?
That you get lost when driving
That you can go in another direction
That you are going to run away
That you will be confused
B

How can we develop a conditioned response?
Having outfits ready the night before
Using our phones to send a message
Using visual or auditory cues
Watching lights
C

What’s the best way to change a habit?
Creating a new habit to add to our routine.
It depends on the person.
Use 66 days of your life to change it
Go for it!
A

What is the difference between a habit and a routine?
They are easily confused
A habit is something you do without an impulse, so you do it all the time.
A habit is a response to an impulse and a routine is something you do without an impulse.
Routines are easier to stick to than habits.
A

Why can breaking a habit be difficult?
Because you need more than 21 days
Lack of knowledge
Because you should read the book
Because it depends on your personality
B

What is the message of this text?
Learning more about habits can make a great difference in your life.
Changing habits little by little can help you make a difference in your life.
Learn more about psychology if you want to change your habits.
Breaking a habit or creating a new one depends on the person and the circumstances	
B
